figure.caption: Figure 83. Top Cover Assembly - Standard and Forward Position

note.para: The standard position top cover and the forward position top cover use different housings. The forward position housing uses a plate and a gasket installed over the detent balls and springs.

step1.para: On forward top covers, remove the bolts that fasten the spring cover plate (if installed) to the top cover. Remove the plate and gasket.

note.para: If a heavy-duty detent spring is used, the spring (different color) is in the bore on the slave valve side of the transmission.

step1.para: If installed, remove the three detent springs and balls from the top of the housing ( Figure 85).

figure.caption: Figure 85. Remove Detent Balls and Springs

caution.para: Do not damage the machined surface of the case. If the surface is damaged, the case will leak.

step1.para: Put the top cover on the bench so that the forks are toward you or in a vise with brass protectors on the jaws.
Remove the bolts that fasten the large and the small oil scoops to the cover (Figure 86).
Cut and remove the lock wire on the fork, sleeve and set screw assembly ( Figure 86).

figure.caption: Figure 86. Remove Bolts Fastening Large and Small Oil Scoops

step1.para: Remove the set screws that fasten the shift fork and sleeve assembly to the shift shafts ( Figure 87).

figure.caption: Figure 87. Remove Set Screws Fastening Shift Fork and Sleeve Assembly

step1.para: Remove the 3-4 shift shaft from the housing. Remove the 3-4 shift sleeve. Remove the 3-4 shift fork ( Figure 88).

figure.caption: Figure 88. Remove 3-4 Shift Shaft, Shift Sleeve, and Shift Fork

step1.para: On Design Level 1, nine-speed transmissions, if necessary, disassemble the 3-4 shift sleeve. Remove the slip that fastens the 3-4 plunger in the housing. Remove the plunger (Figure 89).
Remove the interlock ball from the bottom of the top bore of the first set of bores at the rear of the housing ( Figure 90).
Remove the 1-2 shift shaft, the 1-2 shift fork and the 1-2 shift sleeve from the housing. Remove the pin interlock from the end of the 1-2 shift shaft (Figure 91).

figure.caption: Figure 91. Remove 1-2 Shift Shaft, Shift Fork and Shift Sleeve

step1.para: Remove the interlock ball from the bottom of the middle bore in the first set of bores in the housing ( Figure 92).
Remove the neutral check shaft from the top cover (Figure 93).

note.para: On standard position top covers, one or two reverse switches may be used. On forward position top covers, one reverse switch is used.

step1.para: Remove the reverse switch(es) or plugs from the top of the housing. Remove the long pin(s) from each bore (Figure 94).

figure.caption: Figure 94. Remove Reverse Switches and Long Pin

step1.para: Remove the low-reverse shift shaft. Remove the low-reverse shift sleeve and fork assembly ( Figure 95).

figure.caption: Figure 95. Remove Low-Reverse Shift Shaft, and Sleeve and Fork Assembly

step1.para: If necessary, disassemble the low-reverse sleeve and fork assembly. Remove the slip that fastens the plunger in the housing. Remove the plunger and the spring. Remove the spring and the ball from the bore next to the plunger bore ( Figure 96).
If necessary, remove the breather from the top of the cover (Figure 97).

figure.caption: Figure 97. Remove Breather From Top of Cover

step1.para: Remove the neutral safety switch or plug. Remove the short pin from the bore (Figure 98).
Inspect all parts. Refer to CLEAN AND INSPECT section.

figure.caption: Figure 98. Remove Neutral Safety Switch and Short Pin
